title: Delhi: Calls grow for closure of meat shops during Navratri, traders cite losses - Times of India
content:
1. Delhi: Calls grow for closure of meat shops during Navratri, traders cite losses  Times of India
  2. Why Now Impose A Meat Ban During Navaratri In Delhi? | To The Point With Preeti Chaudhary  India Today
  3. "Will Strictly Enforce Ban On Meat Shops": South Delhi Mayor To NDTV  NDTV
  4. Ghaziabad civic body reverses ban on sale of meat during Navratri  Times of India
  5. As a fasting Hindu, I oppose South Delhi mayor’s move to shut meat shops for Navratri  ThePrint
  6. View Full coverage on Google News
description: With calls growing for closure of meat shops during the ongoing Navratras, traders of non-vegetarian food items are staring at losses. On April 4, South. Delhi Mayor Mukkesh Suryaan ordered the meat shops in SDMC areas to be shut. Traders say they should be told at least 3-4 days in advance to shut shops, otherwise their stock will go waste. Supporters of the meat ban during Navratri say that during this period devout Hindus keep fast and don’t consume even onion and garlic. And sight of meat being sold in the open, especially near temples, makes them uncomfortable.
